definition: to bring up the rear/to provide support/to hold the lines
see 壓根兒|压根儿[ya4 gen1 r5]
to press/to push down/to keep under (control)/pressure
disposition of troops/wave/spate/burst/spell/short period of time/classifier for events or states of short duration

sentences.english: The swarming ranks press on and on, the dense brigades press on.
sentences.chinese: 蜂拥队列纷纷压阵，重旅应先行。

sentences.english: Troops in the parade behind the hold the line, is the Band drum sing.
sentences.chinese: 在阅兵部队后面压阵的，是鼓乐齐鸣的军乐团。

sentences.english: Italy's women's foil team is stacked with the top three fencers in the world.
sentences.chinese: 意大利女子花剑队有三名世界顶级选手压阵。

definition: to provide support/to come to the rescue
to open up a path/to make one's way through/to construct a road/(electricity) open circuit
(of a commanding officer) to keep watch/to oversee
to take up a challenge/to face an attack and meet it
to set out (on a campaign)/to stand for election/to throw one's cap in the ring
